Experience

Technical Executive Date: May/2013 - Nov./2013

I designed posters, videos and set the audio/visual hardware that were used for guest speakers and presentations for the conference. Additionally, I collaborated with various executive members to ensure effective communication in order to execute a successful conference.

Author and Illustrator Date: Sept./2012 - Dec./2013

Utilizing high proficiency in English literature, I produced a fairy tale catering to children between ages 4-12. Using a 3D modelling software (Daz Studio Pro) in collaboration with Photoshop, full-page images of characters and scenery were created to enhance the storyline. Both text and images were stitched together and printed to create the final product.

Math and English Tutor Date: Nov./2011 - May/2013

I tutored children from ages 5-12 in both Math and English, which provided me the opportunity to work alongside teachers from which I gained valuable leadership and communications skills.

Game Developer Date: Feb./2012 - May/2012

As the final project of the computer science course, I created a game using Java with 1000+ lines of efficient code. This resulted in an enjoyable and interactive game incorporating complex algorithms, loops, arrays and coordinate systems.

Mentorship Developer Date: Feb./2011 â€“ Sept./2011

I helped smooth the transition into high school and the IBMYP (International Baccalaureate) program for incoming freshmen. I introduced important concepts of the program to the group that I was given responsibility over. In addition, I planned and executed cheers and interactive activities for my group throughout the day-long conference.

Table Tennis Date: Oct./2011 - March/2014

I played on the school table tennis team for 3 years. I began as a back up player and gradually improved to become one of the best players on the team in my final year. During my time on the team, I was given the opportunity to play during the season and in ROPSSAA tournaments.
